Hi,

DRM19 and DRM22 are based on GRI1.2 and need to be compiled with the
c=
orresponding thermodynamic database, thermo12.dat (from the GRI
website). T=
hese are quite stable. They don't have nitrogen chemistry.
But if you are s=
pecifically looking for GRI3.0 reduced mechanisms the
DRMs may not be the a=
nswer.

There are also some Augmented Reduced Mechanisms (ARMs) based on
GR=
I1.2 and GRI2.11, I think you can get them through the GRI website.
However=
, these are not in chemkin format (they are coded in fortran).
They are har=
d-coded into Fluent, so if you are using that I can email
you instructions =
on how to tap into it.

Note that GRI have stopped supporting GRI2.11 and b=
elow, although some
CFD codes cannot accept >50 species so if you want to u=
se full
chemistry, GRI2.11 is all you can go up to (49 species).

If you wa=
nt to find reduced mechanisms based on GRI3.0, you may need
to trawl some a=
cademic journals to see who's done the most recent
ones. I'm not familiar w=
ith any.

(GRI-Mech web site, http://www.me.berkeley.edu/grimech)

The foll=
owing references have other mechanisms you can try (based on
2.11 and 1.2):=


A Skeletal mechanism, 16 species, 41 reactions
S. James, M.S. Anand, M.K.=
 Razdan, S.B. Pope, J. Eng. Gas Turbines
Power Trans. ASME 123 (2001) 747=
=96756.

16 species 46 reactions
M.D. Smooke, I.K. Puri, K. Seshadri, Proc.=
 Combust. Inst. 21 (1986)
1783=961792.

Here are the references for the Flu=
ent hardcoded mechanisms:
ARM2 (19 Species, 15 (non-elementary) reactions)
=
C.J. Sung, C.K. Law, J.Y. Chen, Combust. Flame 125 (2001) 906-919.

9 speci=
es, 5 (non-elementary) reactions
H.P. Mallampalli, T.H. Fletcher, J.Y. Chen=
, Paper 96F-098, Presented
at the Fall Meeting of the Western States Sectio=
n of the Combustion
Institute, University of Southern California, Los Angel=
es, CA, October
28=9629, 1996.
